umJUbpSiEadSrJf87ycMjw.text: Good atmosphere, good location, good for tourists, not great at anything. That pretty much sums up Horniman's.  The location is one of the best parts of the place at the wharf right on the Thames with the HMS Belfast right there and a nice outdoor space.The food was here good and well priced the selection is just typical Pub food. The pub offers a large bar and a good selection of beers but the service definitely lacks.

ByaETTOOA0bitpEY-hrXNA.text: Huge pub with a wide selection of ales. Very busy and noisy. You can eat upstairs, which we did. Unexceptionable steak menu, nothing fancy, reasonable prices. Waiter pleasant and attentive. Verdict  it's OK.

wvYR0LIcpXeb_r6-G7E5GA.text: Me and some friends came here for after dinner drinks and I was immediately struck with the spectacular view this pub offers. It is situated right on the river in front of the HMS Belfast, a ship I didn't even know about (and I work near here and walk past the buildings that block it from my sight every day). IDIOT!Anyway, a very nice pub, one I hope to stop by more often now that I know about it. I can imagine it getting crowded in the summer since there is quite a nice large outdoor area (but in the snowy wintery cold, it was empty outside). Prices are decent, selections are great, atmosphere is typical for an after-work crowd. Recommended for post-work drinks or if you happen to be in the area, but not for a night out.

sT70BSZeX2ZwFkxZO26QOg.text: Adequate (but by no means great) food, friendly staff, slow service (40 mins between ordering and receiving 3 x fish and chips). Watch out for your bags and phones when the pub is crowded - my partner had a phone stolen here.

t4YU96T0DN46p71dFUSb3g.text: Lovely waterside location. Great selection of wines and ales. Had the loveliest fish and chips, very fresh and the fish melted in your mouth. Only a fiver too! Good sized portion, couldn't eat it all. My friend had the chicken chorizo salad and declared it lovely, but they don't have any salad dressings. Amazingly quick service too. Weirdly, we were the only two women in the place which was reasonably busy!! Great food and a brilliant pub meal price for anywhere, especially London.

c1BdT6faQUUoS6pM8rG30w.text: A vast, busy pub in a great location, often easier to get a seat outside on the river, always difficult to get a seat inside, near impossible to get served at the bar.  They have about four real ales and a similar number of lagers.  The interior is faux victorian opulent, think JD Wetherspoons but with an extra 50p unashamedly squandered on luxurious fittings.  It's not a bad place and there is a great view of the City from the terrace and you are right next door to HMS Belfast,  if you are here for the beer it's fine, if you want to dine, next door at Cote is probably better.

LFn9vHq8FiHWY6ajjDBz6A.text: The best thing about this pub is the view over the Thames, Tower Bridge, the city and in particular HMS Belfast. If you can get a seat outside and watch the sunset in those surroundings, its really something else! They have some interesting brews on tap too but I'm too keen on the huge interior pub area mind you. So I'd say this is one for the milder months of the year.

FwYhjj1Y3HA1BblDDO9eQQ.text: I went to the Horniman (yes, the name does make you giggle slightly!) on a Thursday afternoon after lunchtime and it was really busy. There is a fun, vibrant atmosphere and it is a cosy yet large pub perfectly located next to Hays Gallery.We chose to have lunch here - the menu is pretty good. Quite as you would expect from a pub menu but the healthy side of me was disappointed that everything seemed to come with chips. I went for the vegetable soup (which came with just bread), and it was ok - a bit shop bought tasting but for the cheap price I couldn't complain. My mum and dad had ordered a sandwich each and on arrival of one of them, the waiter informed us that one of orders was not available. Why he couldn't have let us know upon ordering I'm not sure. Still, the portions are huge and the alternative meal came fast and was certainly more than edible.I do think this pub has a lovely charm about it - the setting on the Thames is beautiful and at Christmas time it feels wonderfully festive.

t1vJvc5ZJRSmdRY5FAUNvw.text: I am genuinely astonished by other reports of the Horniman. Maybe I'm far too demanding a but it is in my opinion simply the very worst pub I have been to. Ever. Take a large public house, in a perfect location - views of the River, HMS Belfast, Tower of London & Bridge, Gherkin, St.Ps, large outside area, right by the station, add a varied menu and some interesting ales and beers. Then do everything you can to ruin this potential. This pub just cannot sink any lower in my estimation. Everything about it is terrible - the beer (not just the ales, even the lagers always taste off. Dirty lines?), the food, the staff, the management (by far the lowest point), the time you have to wait at the bar while gormless drones do F.A. (then sulk when you have the audacity to ask them to serve you drinks in return for ready money. One or the other of us has misunderstood the relationship I thought existed between barman/maid and customer Maybe some one could enlighten me?) I know that may sound harsh but I just could not put up with that place any longer and boycotted it.

wcGXDmBqRTvyrU3zr61ZYw.text: The Horniman is one of the most popular and therefore crowded bars in London Bridge, especially during the summer months when the crowds of workers spill outside, taking advantage of the rivers views and the cool breeze. What is essentially a very large pub over two levels, the bar is long but service can be slow, but polite. They serve food which makes it a great place for groups or lunch if you don't mind traditional but unexciting grub. Prices are also good. Great place for a sneaky drink after work or if walking down the by the river.

o255RplzaFJPhKYCNybuow.text: It was a little difficult to find, which was embarrassing having to ask strangers where the Horniman is....but once we were there, we had a wonderful meal and great beers.  I still crave the lamb shank pot pie!!  And the view and building itself are beautiful.  Definitely recommend this place for visitors.

bkc_yz4kG9EoEh8LrgUQaQ.text: I'm not sure if i like this pub, but on a mission to cheer me up when I was blue, my friends took my out for some wine. We ended up here. It might just be to big for me. I mean, it's really really really big. And packed. It's friendly enough, but I'm not sure that there's anything too special about the place. It was nice to have a view of the river, but you can do that in so many pubs across London Bridge that I'm not sure this is the best place to be. Bottle of wine was about £10. I'm pleased the guys dragged me out of the house and took me here, but unless I'm in the area and can't think of anywhere else, I won't be rushing back.

fYegIFFwpJYuR4RkpdYffA.text: Situated right by the river with great views stretching down to Tower Bridge, taking in HMS Belfast, the Gherkin and many other wonderful London buildings, this is an extremely busy and unpretentious pub that's worth checking out. The huge bar and interior can hold many, though conditions do get cramped around the bar and the service can take a while, not that the staff are lazy, just that it is so busy. Seats are available upstairs and in addition outside with a bog-standard menu should you get an attack of the hunger-pains! Large selection of draught beer and cider alonsgide many bottles means there's plenty of choice. Be warned, on a summer evening this place is heaving, but then you won't mind going outside and taking in that aforementioned view.

iP0yLqM41jd0j2hQYFMYFg.text: Standing right on the river, this is an understably popular for after work drinks - thus, it does get pretty crowded at certain times. The food is decent, as are drinks; both are reasonably priced. There are tables outside, right on the riverfront, offering pretty spectacular views. Undercover and heater, these are pleasant all year round. The mix of people depends very much on the time of day, in my experience. It is not a particularly 'classy place', but nor does it seem particularly rough. All in all, I think this is a good place to stop as you explore one of the nicest parts of London.

oGI21_KHA7fd-Y4Jfd8qyQ.text: I visited this pub again on 1st March. I particularly wanted to go because of the choices of fish on the menu. I was disappointed to see that the menu had changed and there was only 1 choice now (hake). Still, fish and chips was 2 fish for £9.95 or 3 for £10.95, so go when you are hungry! The menu was good, and the pies looked really tasty.A good choice of beers (another reason to go) but the barmaid didn't know if they had any Czech beer (our favourite) until I pointed out the Pilsner Urquell on draught.It wasn't busy when I visited, so service was good, but previously it has been slow when busy. I would recommend this pub for beer choice alone, and food is hot and tasty.

X8W8ipgHFAxHYMiMpNbu-Q.text: Horniman's was my first experience eating in London.  Let's just say I thought the food was amazing.  Whether it was or not, I'm not really sure.  Considering me and my hungry friends got there at 11:45, got our orders in before the kitchen closed at 12, and then waited over an hour because they forgot our food.  When you're that hungry, everything tastes pretty good, right?

wcTTiXmCjlBJxHLldGJ2Tg.text: The Horniman is one of a select few pubs which can boast a Thameside location, as such its views are brilliant and during the summer months the outdoor seating area is an excellent place for a pint. The staff is generally adept although service can be slow during peak hours. The drinks are somewhat pricey and the food could be better. But all things considered it is still a worthy place to have an evening pint.

7a0LGaIdIcuEixNbkGEapg.text: I'm really surprised that no one has reviewed this place yet. Situated along the river at the edge of the lovely Hays Galleria, the Horniman is a prime spot for after work drinking, especially in the summer. The pub itself is quite large, well-staffed and the food on offer isn't too pricey and is decent. There are quite a few tables outside along the water, but they go quickly so it's a good idea to get there early and hold on to one for dear life! It's a quite touristy spot, right next to the Belfast ship and with beautiful views across the water of Tower Bridge and the City, but it's a great place to spend a few hours watching the world go by.

7gXl4S_HbzYjDQpk_J3sxg.text: Waters were lovely but the food was cold! They storted it out and all was well in the end! nice place to have a pub and large inside. Would be good for xmas party but hope the chef keep an eye on the temputure of the meals!!!! Dishes are standard pub food and the chips and fish is clean and fresh!

DyGDUDv7nrk8LmQH_OkQxA.text: to be fair thispub wasnt too bad at all, its one of the major chain ones, but the building has got a continental brasserie vibe (tiled floor etc) quite a big selection of beers on offer and a great river side view which is always a plus.

Irzz2BbZMLI-C8F85Am6ww.text: Nice place to grab a quick beer afterwork, but never really stayed long enough to see what it's like for an evening, the view is great overlooking the river and nice outside area (which will be nice when we get that one or so of summer this year). Some of the draft beers are rather strange but I'd recommend the doombar but suggest you stay away from the juipur, which was too tart for my liking.

photos.caption: Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom. View from window seat
Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom. Main bar

tcysH8wHulPyBJgb5QC09A.text: Hey, it's not too bad. As an American looking for something to eat walking along the river there that's not gonna be too weird or expensive, it was decent. We checked out the menus to the other spots in the same center and went with this one. It was around 5-6pm & we were hungry after hitting the tourist sights. We were weirded out when we walked in because there was no host or sign telling you about seating. After making a round around the place, we asked the bar tender for info. The way it works is you're supposed to seat yourself, pick your menu choice, & walk back up to the bar and place your order. You must give the number of your table so the staff knows who to bring it out to. Weird. Different...But it worked. I ordered the chicken breast burger, it came out with ground beef patties. By the time they fixed the order & it came out, the rest of my table was almost done eating. Sad face.

NbaELklfzAsCy9UiwhvZ4w.text: Good pub, gets very busy but you can book an area. We got stuck by the kitchen as they were a bit dissorganised but still pretty good and nice location

k1XRSPD59f5mlkx_1l34bg.text: In a nutshell - it's a pub. In a larger nutshell - it's a pub that is close to my office - so I do find myself there quite a few times. On a sunny day you can enjoy your glass of Pinot Grigio overlooking the river and feeling the light breeze on your face. On a cold winter night - they have heaters in the same area - and it is as nice nevertheless.I've had a couple of meals here and all were to a good pub standard - nothing exceptional but not bad either. Service is pretty quick - even on a Friday night - they are quite efficient there, despite of the place often getting extremely crowded.What good about it is its location. If you happen to work nearby - then it's a good place to have a few drinks before hitting some other, more 'hip' place either in the City or West.

8l5ItPuUQ1f_620c3-cE0w.text: An adequate pub as you trudge along the south bank of the Thames on your way to Tower bridge. Nice wide selection of beers on tap. Many choices of seating type. We came on a cold winter day and it was fairly busy (if poorly heated). I'm sure this place is a tourist zoo during good weather.

photos.caption: Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom

aYhhqwLMjqT6R8hGaL67gw.text: While walking towards Tower Bridge, I was hungry and I saw a neat looking green pub. It looked like an Irish pub near my workplace, so I decided to go inside. I went inside and a lady brought me a menu and I kinda laughed at myself because of the name of the place. Okay, I'm at a pub, and I don't drink alcohol and I'm one of those people who like to eat healthy most of the time. I kept my promise, and I ordered a traditional English ploughman's lunch. I wasn't expecting anything spectacular because the ploughman's lunch came with just bread, cheese, apple, tomato, avocado. celery, egg, and a salad. Although the ingredients were fresh, the dish just tasted really quite bland and I probably should have order some greasy fish and chips instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom. The Horniman at Hay's.

mo3ZbgckUKV6lSzrJu57ug.text: LOOOOVE THE NAMELove the viewLove the drinks - not too £££$$$They can take their time serving though, and food can also take a while to come.

oBeu8CPl9c1gZ4JoG3diiw.text: The main reason I come here isn't really for the pub itself. The pub is nice enough.. there are drinks and lights and seating like any other pub. The prices are standard, as is the service. The alcoholic treats are of good quality, but the food is average and the bar is always a little bit past too crowded.But what brings me here is none of these things. What brings me here is the view from the garden out front. Battleships. Great big metal battleships. And they are awesome.Someday I will steal one and invade Belgium. (Jokes....)

6nGojiMm2t_KJJTrZLMxaw.text: So if you've read any of my past reviews, you'll see I'm a bit nutty about London. One of things I LOVE about it is that sunny afternoon where you're just in the mood for a nice relaxing glass of wine with friends by the sparkling river, catching some rays and people-watching (if that was a sport, I would finally be classed as athletic!) Right by London Bridge is one of my new fave spots to do this. So perfectly situated is Horniman at Hays.This particular trip we couldn't find an outside spot (it was just too popular!) so we plumped for a table inside - a good second choice considering how nice the inside is! Filled with tables on different mezzanine levels, it reminded me a little bit of Hogwarts with all the staircases (you know in that hall where they all move?) but this just adds to the charm I think. We decided to accompany our drinks (typical London Bridge price) with some nachos and chicken wings to nibble on - again good price and really nice afternoon snacks. All in all, you can't moan with a life like this!

mQtqJyFk-rZdadnXMZ-N7w.text: There are five reasons as to why I am giving Horniman's 5 stars: 1. The name, obviously. Any restaurant that puts horni(y) and man in the same phrase is a winner in my book. Hands down. 2. This is where I had my first Rekorderling Cider. OMG. LOVE! Love I tell you! These ciders are not available in the US, and I may return to Europe for the sole reason of purchasing cases of this cider and having it shipped home. Horny for this cider. For reals. 3. They have the perfect river/sidewalk/view seating. Located right along the river at the end of a shopping area you have the river sights, the Tower Bridge views, the lights (at night) and the people walking. This A+ location is a total turn on. 4. The bar and restaurant has great decor and a really fun vibe. The atmosphere was perfect for after work drinks, a drink with a lover, or kicking off a two week vacation in Europe with three of your best friends. We didn't try the food, but booze always wins me over (and makes me horny if there's enough of it)! 5. The fifth reason, and by far the most important. THEY SERVE SIERRA NEVADA PALE ALE!!! Hollar Chico grads w00t, w00t! Love to see the ye ole college town (and college brew) representing across the seas.Horniman's, I totes dig you.

X8cNIQjmwlVSuYVYuqRexg.text: I have been to the Horniman many times when I worked around here - it's a nice venue, good location, clean and cosy.  On this occasion, I discovered that there is a secret room downstairs, which can be hired for parties - that was nice! I've never eaten here, but it's great for a summer evening drink by the Thames.

6DzdsK4E983Eb8xWBLlaLA.text: The Hay's Galleria is a little shopping mall by the London Bridge station. It has always struck me as quite oddly placed but I guess there are a lot of workers and few people living in the area. At the back of the Galleria, on the river, is the Horniman pub. It is a good sized pub, and whilst the decor it does look a little like a  brasserie. The bar is low slung with lots of inside seating. There is also covered seating outside so you can sit out and watch the river. The Horniman is perhaps a little out of the way. However, whilst not particularly exciting it is a nice place and perfectly pleasant for a couple of drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom

NJaSlb9pxOu2wz2-qZMcew.text: The food and the drinks are pretty good i mostly go there for the beautiful view of the thames

DfpbFp1HsRdkj4O_r8gZOw.text: Just okay. The views are great. The beer is good. However, it took 40 minutes to get a selection of starters. They need to be better (and friendlier) staffed. You can't beat the location for the view and people watching. I have had the food before and it was fine. Good for after work or a nice afternoon but not an evening destination.

f_v8VNlBTb8bBlJNIkVo0A.text: Came here after visiting the Tower - it's a nice enough pub but the food wasn't spectacular. We were quite hungry and I'm probably being a little bit generous with my review considering my appetite at the time.We both ordered fish and chips. It was served with some sort of Indian Daal in a small bowl. It was a random thing to serve with fish and chips and there was no explanation as to what it was. Mushy peas I get. Daah? No. That's just bizarre. I was a bit peeved that we were charged for tartar sauce with our fish. Is this par for the course in London? I can't imagine it is. Also, we ordered at the bar and it was a bit confusing as to how our food would reach us. They weren't clear.While it was an OK dining experience, I probably wouldn't return when there are so many more amazing places to dine in this city.

ki2p0OeKasiO0Ep02WhNyg.text: I have a friend who will only go for a beer in this pub. I think he fears change. I wish we didn't always have to come here, as I don't really like it. A few other people have said its too massive, and I agree, and the service is so slow - even once it started to empty out it still took 5 minutes or more to get served as the number of bar staff on duty reduced as soon as it got less busy. On the plus side, good selection of ales.

bz0fFows9ShYBCsT1Dm_uQ.text: The food is slightly better than average pub food that otherwise totally disagrees with me. I liked the ambience somewhat, and service was just acceptable, though rather slow.

sfyeJEHDNR2IROahh-xx3Q.text: Nice pub with good selection of beer. Great outlook too with the Thames just out front. Worth the walk from London bridge station.

tP6uUt9xX33f4P7ssHL9xQ.text: #3 on the London Bridge to Tower Bridge DW ale trail is the Horniman (teehe) At Hays. It's tucked within a shopping type centre right along the river Thames. When I was awaiting my mates to join me to kick off our ale trail we couldn't help but be excited about the name. Yes, we may be old enough to drink, but that doesn't me we can't be childish sometimes. I LOVE the inside of this pub. It's is just stunning! During the summer months they have a fabulous outdoor seating area, but I can't wait to brave through the cold to warm myself up in one of the many different seating areas inside. There is a lot of iron cast railings, giving it this feeling of old victoria England. The upstairs dinning room overlooks the river Thames as well as inside of the pub. You walk up what must have been a somewhat grand staircase back in the day. That however is where the good stuff ends with the Horniman. The staff indeed are not very friendly at all, they kind of seem aggravated that you are even there. The menu/drink list is the same as the other Nicholson's, it can either be good or not that great just depends on what you want and how the kitchen staff are feeling that day. There are loads of stairs and no wheelchair access. The restrooms are along a narrow small stairway, sometimes they tend to be busy as the pub is extremely large. Due to the space it's fabulous for groups. It's just a shame that this place has such potential that it's not reaching. I don't recommend it for spending the entire night drinking away your money, but it's definitely worth checking out just because of how you'll feel once you step inside. Whether you're horni or not, everyone can enjoy an hour or two here.

jkOPDemZioDSC9Yq3afs4Q.text: The best thing about this pub is the fact that you can sit right on the river and watch the world go by - but to be honest, there are many better places to do it. The drinks are pretty pricey, with bar staff who have to be amongst the slowest in the world. There is nearly always at least a 2 deep queue around the bar, which isn't great for anyone! Fair enough, it is quite an airy place, they do have a lot of tables outside and if you can't find one, you can just hang around without being shouted at (which is rare!). I've also heard that the food is good, but there are too many irritating elements to this pub for me to make an effort to go back to find out.

iyKEE-cT1XlQaixOFk8PaQ.text: Fantastic fish and chips. Atmosphere is spot on locals British pub Filled with locals enjoying a pint or two We had the charcuterie plate and the delicious fish and chips. What's up with those mashed peas??

photos.caption: Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom

T3td_MdlPX41z920WTAglQ.text: Very rude staff. Unfriendly and reluctant to help. Tried ordering an avocado sandwich and was told they couldn't make it, but didn't specify the ingredients they were out of. Asked if it could be made without avocado and was still told no. There is no signage to help direct customers where to sit or how to order, and when asking the staff, was met with attitude. They don't care about the safety of their customers either. Constantly allowing the customers sitting outside to be bothered by beggars, solicitors, and thiefs. Could find better food and service elsewhere

jlbJgruLLX1htHU5tbwG_Q.text: A name that gives you all the jokes and likely not the best place for a first date.Decent food, good price, and lovely atmosphere around a nice environment near the river!

photos.caption: Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom

wfUNn53FEeXqqAfJyOzeCQ.text: Great location near the river. However, it is understaffed. Skip the Nicholson Pale Ale unless you like the taste of vinegar. This is the only beer offered with the burger special. The fish and chips are okay, nothing to write home about. Portion size was decent. Atmosphere is good! Plenty of room for big parties. We didn't receive ketchup and condiments so we had to search for them. Wouldn't recommend coming back.

dEjXzxMkRYXdK6pZ4Km0Ww.text: Unfriendly service and inadequately staffed at the bar where you place your order for your meal. Our food took over 35 minutes to arrive and each of the four entrees was prepared incorrectly. Burgers, a club sandwich, and a steak & cheese; should not have been complicated. We were one of the only tables when we sat down and we watched all the tables that arrived after us receive their food ahead of us. The food was over cooked, meat was gristly, chips were cold. We overheard the table next to us complain to one another of the same experience.

2Y_OuN7VSUiAC-z-OhRuWg.text: Very nice pub, one of the best interiors in the neighborhood. High ceilings, beautiful bar and river view. Besides beer they also specialize in gins. So you may have different types with carefully selected flavors and tonic. We haven't tried food, but the menu looked quite interestin, as for a bar of course.Will happily be back sometime.

fDhdh0qLAj03goP-vjidyA.text: Decent pub on the southbank for after work drinks. I've been here a few times and it really is just a big standard pub. I haven't tried the food here. It's saving grace is the location - right outside the HMS Belfast, near to the Mayors Office and a short walk away from London Bridge!

dVEXv0LXZnwm8a3RnlX4XQ.text: Great atmosphere for after work drinks. Interesting selection on tap for ale and cider. Thought I had tried it all when it came to cider but discovered something new this evening! Staff were polite and we were served relatively quickly despite how busy the bar was

owGv0KebKGsE0UYh0OsQ0Q.text: We asked if they had an accessible entrance (we had a baby and a pram with us). They said there was a ramp around the corner. Get to the ramp and the door is locked. We're knocking on the door, no-one comes. We have to use the main entrance and carry the pram down the stairs...Kind of got me in a bad mood!Food was okay. Got the pork belly and mash with vegetables. The vegetables tasted like they were from a frozen packet. The pork was good. Not worth the price though. Really big, spacious pub - liked the inside. But it really didn't meet my expectations.

CpjPgdxYxUkDa5b1fEt7jg.text: Don't go here. Service is slow. But that's ok. But they don't observe that you came first. They literally ignore it.  Don't come here. Please. They have to learn.

YpdmrMlaylF-nPb-qbRxCw.text: Had average scampi - other people had food that looked better but mine was a small, boring portion. It was also quite dark and gloomy, which wasn't great as we partly went there as it was on the riverside and felt summery. My friends later saw a mouse after I left.

m8egTqo1FBh3aoO8vuEThg.text: When your traveling abroad in London and you want the quintessential "pub" experience, this is the place. Classic architecture mixed with quite little cubbies for isolated seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom. Nice roasted flavour
Photo of Horniman At Hays - London, United Kingdom. Enjoying a classic English Porter.

A4dQPXp2JGmx6VFWNAyU_g.text: Two stars for the viewOne star for the reasonable pricesBut that's it. Nothing special about this place. Drinks food service.

8b6gLkmL36fjVoQCzxvhmA.text: Average at most. The pub does look nice. But that is all. Staff is not really overeager. Food  was disapointing. Audience poshy. All in all definitely not what you wish for.

qW5lRn4vprZWhin9Rg8CIg.text: This was the second worst meal we had during an entire week in London.  Location was convenient to our hotel, but that is about the only plus.  The fish n chips was quite greasy and lacked flavor.

W9p1r0TKfd3vWb3e2z7ZnA.text: The first restaurant we tried in London. We heard London was full of fish and chips place. This place was your regular bar. And bar type foods. The fish was huge and didn't taste too bad. I wouldn't make my top 10 fish list

7TzFbo1ZEuaNQn0CTL9yjw.text: Try somewhere else as there is plenty of better around. Fish was once frozen and tasted soggy when cooked, and chips must of been sitting under a hot plate for a long time. This pub must up its game or down its prices!

WF11X1Iuy8RG3fHelnziww.text: Great pub right on the Thames! We had the fish and chips, the steak and pale ale pie with mash, and both were great. The portion size was nice and filling as well. Awesome atmosphere, especially around Christmas. We would definitely return!

vG4t6upoJSuqrP6EaB1JkQ.text: Nice pub.  Traditional, tasteful decor and a lively, friendly vibe.  That's what makes the place.Right on the river too, which will make it a winner, no doubt in the Summer.   The staff, however, seemed surly and indifferent.  Food was average and slightly over-priced.

_fjY03Xd2nPJo1Ku7h84KA.text: Good pub atmosphere at lunch time and very busy.Meals are small portions, not particularly tasty and expensive. The burger is okay though.If you have the time I would recommend walking to the nearby Horseshoe pub.
